newsitem.title: FRANCE: French teenager jailed for causing train crash.
newsitem.headline: French teenager jailed for causing train crash.

text.p: A French court has jailed a teenager for seven years for planting a piece of metal on a railway line "just to see what would happen", radio and television said on Sunday.
The metal derailed a commuter train, causing a collision in which four people died.
The unnamed 19-year-old, who has been held since the accident three years ago, told the court he had put a heavy piece of metal, left behind by maintenance workers, on the track.
He said he had expected the train would simply twist the metal and had not thought it could cause an accident.
Four people died and 27 were injured when the commuter train smashed into a local train in the morning rush hour at Saint-Leu d'Esserent, 60 km (35 miles) north of Paris.
The state prosecutor had sought a 10-year prison term.
